resources.string: Your Master Password is a password that you keep safe and only use on SaltThePass.\nIdeally, you should never disclose it to anyone else, or even write it down.
For simplicity, the Domain Name you use should match the website you\'re generating a password for.
The Domain Phrase is an optional field that can be used to differentiate multiple accounts/passwords on the same website.
The Version Name is an optional field that can be used to indicate a version number or name.\nThis is useful for websites that require frequent password changes.

The Password Appendix is an optional field. The appendix replaces the end of the generated password.\nThis is useful for websites that require specific characters in their passwords that are not normally generated by this tool.
The Password Length is the target length of the generated password.\nThe maximum possible length depends on the hashing function used.
The Salted Password is the output of your Master Password, combined with the Domain Name and Domain Phrase (optional).
The Salted Password is the output of your Master Password, combined with the Domain Name, Domain Phrase (optional) and Version Name (optional).\nThe Password Appendix (optional) is used at the end.

SaltThePass uses a cryptographic hash function as part of the algorithm that generates your Salted Password. Each hash function will provide different output, so if you ever change the hash function you use, you will get a different Salted Password. By default, Keccak512 is used.

On the original SaltThePass, the hashing algorithm labeled SHA-3 is really Keccak512. This is due to some historical confusion between the two.\nIn this app, use Keccak512 to match SaltThePass.com\'s SHA-3.

SaltThePass Manager uses hashing algorithms to generate passwords based on a master password, without the need to store the passwords themselves.\nSaltThePass Manager is based on the original SaltThePass.com web app by Nic Jansma. Visit SaltThePass.com for more information about the SaltThePass algorithm and how it can be used.
SaltThePass Manager is an open source application with an MIT License. Copyright (c) 2023 Ewoud van Pareren.
When closing the window, keep the application alive in the system tray
